thread.title: Apple rolls out Watch OS 2
thread.title_full: Apple rolls out Watch OS 2 - The Times of India

author: Techradar
title: Apple rolls out Watch OS 2
text:
The big watchOS 2 update for the Apple Watch was supposed to come out on September 16 but was delayed due to a major bug - however it looks like you can download it now. 

Apple hasn't released the details of the problem it was trying to fix -- and likely won't tell us -- so hopefully everything will run smoothly after installation. 

Your iPhone will need to update to iOS 9 before you can update your Watch. After this is done, it's simply a matter of heading to the Apple Watch app and checking to see if the software is available. Don't fret if it's not there just yet - it's still rolling out. Apple Watch: All you want to know of 11 Apple gave the world more details about its upcoming smartwatch, Apple Watch, on March 9.

Apple Watch, which the company also calls its 'most personal device ever' marks its entry into the sluggish wearable market. 

At the event CEO Tim Cook touted many of the Apple Watch's features including making phone calls, reading emails and more. 

As the Apple fans get ready to welcome the watch here's a ready reckoner on the Apple's newest device. Apple poised for success with watch: Analysts Apple Watch will be available in nine countries from April 24. Pre-orders for the Apple watch start April 10. These include USA, UK, Australia, China, Canada, France, Germany, Hong Kong and Japan.

There are no details available on the watch's India launch so far. Apple Watch prices start at $349 with Apple Watch Sport, aimed at fitness enthusiasts, in anodized aluminium in silver or space gray, with colourful band choices.

Apple Watch stainless steel starts at $549, in traditional and space black. The third variant is Apple Watch Edition, an 18-karat yellow or rose gold version with a starting price of $10,000. Apple Watch promises 18 hours of life on a single charge. The company claims that the smartwatch sports a unique charging solution that combines Apple's MagSafe technology with inductive charging for a quick connection.
